dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 295 IH: Fair Milk Pricing for Farmers Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Langworthy (for himself, Mr. Van Orden, Mr. Morelle, Mr. Finstad, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Moolenaar, Mr. Costa, Mr. Newhouse, and Mr. Valadao) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 with respect to mandatory reporting of dairy products processing costs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fair Milk Pricing for Farmers Act.

section.header: Mandatory reporting of dairy products processing costs
section.text: Section 273 of the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 (7 U.S.C. 1637b) is amended—

clause.text: in subparagraph (A)(ii), by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (B), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: for each manufacturer required to report under subparagraph (A) for any product, require that manufacturer to report production cost and product yield information, as determined by the Secretary, for all products processed in the same facility or facilities.
in paragraph (2)(A), by inserting products and after those; and
in the subsection heading, by striking Electronic reporting and inserting Reporting;

clause.text: in the heading, by striking Electronic reporting and inserting Reporting; and
by striking this section and inserting in its place subparagraphs (A) and (B) of subsection (b)(1);

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking this section and inserting in its place subparagraphs (A) and (B) of subsection (b)(1); and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Not later than 3 years after the date of enactment of this paragraph, and every 2 years thereafter, the Secretary shall publish a report containing the information obtained under subparagraph (C) of subsection (b)(1).
